Lesha likes to split arrays into several parts. This time Lesha decided to split the arrayAinto several, possibly one, new arrays so that the sum of elements in each of the new arrays is not zero. One more condition is that if we place the new arrays one after another they will form the old arrayA.Lesha is tired now so he asked you to split the array. You are given an array of integers.  You need to split the array into several subarrays.  

The following rules must be followed:

* The sum of elements in each subarray must not be zero.
* The subarrays must be placed end-to-end to form the original array.

If it is possible to split the array according to these rules, output "YES" followed by the number of subarrays. Then, output the starting and ending indices of each subarray.

If it is not possible to split the array, output "NO".

Given a list of numbers, split the list into multiple sublists. Each sublist must have a sum that is not zero, and the sublists must be placed together in order to form the original list.  If this is possible, output "YES" followed by the number of sublists and the starting and ending indices of each sublist. If it's not possible, output "NO".
